verses.roman:
nijācintya-śaktye mālī hañā skandha haya
sakala śākhāra sei skandha mūlāśraya

synonyms: nija—His own; acintya—inconceivable; śaktye—by potency; mālī—gardener; hañā—becoming; skandha—trunk; haya—became; sakala—all; śākhāra—of other branches; sei—that; skandha—trunk; mūla-āśraya—original support.
translation: By His inconceivable powers, the Lord became the gardener, the trunk and the branches simultaneously.
